examples: It was so hot outside that all the plants died.
He was so good, they hired him on the spot.
You behaviour so incensed me that I even thought of firing you.
It was so cold a day that I could hardly breathe outside.
So ridiculously did I do in the exam that mom grounded me for a month.
I need a piece of cloth so long. [= this long]
I feel so much better now.
I so nearly lost my temper.
It’s not so bad. [i.e. it's acceptable]
But I so want to see the Queen when she visits our town!

definitions.definition: In the same manner or to the same extent as aforementioned; likewise , also .
examples: Just as you have the right to your free speech, so I have the right to mine. Many people say she's the world's greatest athlete, but I don't think so . "I can count backwards from one hundred." " So can I."
He wants to eat now. So does she.
‘Look, it’s just stopped raining.’ ‘ So it has!’
‘There are two more.’ ‘ So there are.’

definitions.definition: : To such an extent or degree; as .
examples: so far as; so long as; so much as

secondary_definitions: In the same manner or to the same extent as aforementioned; likewise , also .
( with as ) : To such an extent or degree; as .
